Articles.Content:
I want to know how much of players have landed on the Mun. Please use the poll to write whether or not you have.

I assume about half have, half have not.
I could do it in my sleep.
About finishing up my campaign of getting samples from every single biome. Which you have to do twice per biome to get close to 100% (unless someone knows a trick to do it in one visit).
My guess is more than half the forum users make it to Mun and Minmus. However, Duna and beyond you will likely see a large drop-off.

I regularly take this there and back with two kerbals, a buggy and some experiment packages....

...100% stock parts, no mods...

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/28073-New-Rebuild!-Apollo-Replica-Munbug-XI-Saturn-V-CSM-Lander-Buggy-and-A-L-S-E-P

I could do it in my sleep.

Yeah, this. So many times in so many ways.
Wow! No one hasn't done it so far!

I have had many mission to Mun and back. once I figured out to use Minmus as a training for landing (it is very forgiving) I was able to perfect my technique so I did not crash half my landers and have to send a rescue mission. Now I only get stuck on Mun when testing a new rocket designed or not paying attention and I run out of fuel.

Edited March 3, 2014 by Nepos
Found on of my landing pics

About finishing up my campaign of getting samples from every single biome. Which you have to do twice per biome to get close to 100% (unless someone knows a trick to do it in one visit).

You could try using two cockpits, see if you can put one sample in one and a second from the same biome in a second.

I'm going to try this and report back here.

Keep in mind that the population set is highly skewed because people who are active forum users are much more likely to be competent. Interest in participating in the forums is directly related to in-game capability, someone who can't yet perform a Mun landing isn't likely to be participating in forum discussions.

Honestly, I stopped counting my Mun landings a LONG time ago... It was added not long after I started playing, and for the longest time it was one of the only places you COULD go. Even after the solar system expanded, the Mun was an easy target. The addition of so many new craters somewhat recently only made it more fun to do so.
Oh, a time or two.

I want to know how much of players have landed on the Mun.

Who hasn't?

Keep in mind that the population set is highly skewed because people who are active forum users are much more likely to be competent. Interest in participating in the forums is directly related to in-game capability, someone who can't yet perform a Mun landing isn't likely to be participating in forum discussions.

That is true. Also maybe people who haven't landed on the Mun wouldn't care about a "Mun Landings" thread

Also they might be intimidated by the 35 people who all landed...

Keep in mind that the population set is highly skewed because people who are active forum users are much more likely to be competent. Interest in participating in the forums is directly related to in-game capability, someone who can't yet perform a Mun landing isn't likely to be participating in forum discussions.

So true and sad because when I first started just coming here and doing a quick search you find a ton of useful info to get your space program going. The game can be frustrating but once you understand it you start challenging yourself because you can do the basics like a Mun landing.

I think that many people are forced to go to the Mun early on, maybe as a rite of passage, a goal, practice for larger missions. But whatever you do it for, you'd be hard-pressed to find anyone who hasn't landed and came back yet.

I think that many people are forced to go to the Mun early on, maybe as a rite of passage, a goal, practice for larger missions. But whatever you do it for, you'd be hard-pressed to find anyone who hasn't landed and came back yet.

Maybe if I went in the New Players section, I'd find mostly people who haven't yet (although some land on the Mun in the demo before buying the game or joining the forums)
Been landing there since 0.13. Less often now that there are so many other places to go.

Yup here we go:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

You can stash a surface sample from a given biome in each cockpit and bring home two (or more, I suppose) of each.

I also learned that my Mun science is not nearly as complete as I thought it was.

I've landed more on Minmus, but yeah, I can make it to the Mun and back. Contemplating whether my next mission from my Minmus station should be another local biome-hop, or a quasi-Apollo-style Munshot.
pretty conclusive results here... 100%.

I do it every now and then just to keep in practice, in fact I landed there first before Minmus. While Minmus is more forgiving I feel Mun is where you should start for the shear challenge, but that is just me.
Going to the Mun is my hobby.

The mun and minmus are easy for me. I'm at the point where I want to build a vessel to go to Duna. I've landed on Duna before but never came back since I just stopped playing for awhile, and then .22 and .23 came out.

Many, MANY times.. keep in mind i started in 0.16 and with each update i started anew..

This is just my latest endevour, still few more Biomes left, only marked the main biomes with flags, but done in this game many more mun landings, mostly for kethane extration.

By now, i dont even have to give an efford to land on the mÃƒÂ¼n and go back to the kerbin, this is just for me a routine flight with no challenges anymore.
